sections.header: A quick guide to navigating the build models section

rows.header: Navigating the Hippocampus Hub Build section

columns.content:
On the Hippocampus Hub (HFH) Build section page, the users select, via the relevant buttons or from the top menu bar in the home page, the resources they want to access.
Currently two resource pages are available: Data and Models. These can be explored through user-friendly point-and-click interfaces.

The Data section is made up of three subsections: Connections, Morphologies, Electrophysiology, with data collected from internal and external resources.
The Connections page displays neural connectivity information relative to hippocampal areas. New data will be continuously integrated as further resources are made available. For both the pre and postsynaptic neurons of a given connection, relevant information are shown (e.g., cell name, hippocampal region and layer, original paper where the connection is referred to). The user can either display all the available connections listed on the entry page or a subset of them through a dedicated filter panel where Regions and Layers of interest can be selected, for both pre and postsynaptic neurons. For each connection, the link to the source web page is provided.
The Morphologies page shows hippocampal neuron reconstructed morphologies. For each morphology, a dedicated panel is provided containing relevant information (e.g., morphology name, cell species, cell region, physical integrity of the morphology) and a set of interactive links. These allow to: 1) download the morphology file (in .asc format) or select it for batch download; 2) open the file source web page; 3) select the morphology for further processing (see below, section Integration with the Hodgkin-Huxley Neuron Builder); 4) zoom in and out a 2D image and 5) show an interactive 3D representation of the morphology. The users can select the data of interest through the filter panel (filter keys are: Species, Region and Cell Type).
Similarly to the Connections page, the Electrophysiology page displays information and links relative to the hippocampal cell electrophysiology. Data can be filtered by Region and Layers and a link to the source page is provided.

The Models page provides a list computational models related to the hippocampus from internal and external resources. Information on individual models (e.g., model name and type, NEURON .mod files, reference paper) are displayed on dedicated panels and interactive buttons allow to download (or batch download) the models or open the corresponding source page. In order to restrict the number of items displayed, the user can filter the data through the following keys: Channels, Receptors, Model Concepts, Implementers.

rows.header: Integration with the Hodgkin-Huxley Neuron Builder

columns.content:
One of the final goals of the Build section of the Hippocampal Facility Hub is to guide the user through the construction of biophysically detailed hippocampal single cell models, optimized against electrophysiological data. In order to achieve this goal, we have integrated the resources available within the HFH with the EBRAINS Hodgkin-Huxley Neuron Builder.
The Hodgkin-Huxley Neuron Builder panel is automatically populated with the morphology and model files chosen by the user during navigation of the Morphologies and Models pages. At any time the user is allowed to check files being used for the model construction, at any time.
Once the selection is completed, by clicking on the Launch HH Neuron Builder button, the users are redirected to the HH Neuron Builder workflow page through which they can complete the model building, launch the model optimization on an HPC system and finally fetch and use the optimized model.

'CNR-IBF Hippocampus Facility Hub Project's' use of Cookies

'CNR-IBF Hippocampus Facility Hub Project' section and online services may use 'cookies'. Cookies are small text files placed on the hard drive of your device.

There are several types of cookies: Session cookies are temporary bits of information that are erased once you exit your web browser window or otherwise turn your computer off. Persistent cookies remain on your computer until you delete them or they expire.

When you access the HH Build Models Section, we can, according to your settings, install cookies on your devices, which will allow us to recognize your browser, during the validity time of the cookies. The cookies that 'CNR-IBF Hippocampus Facility Hub Project' generates allow us:
- to prepare statistics including frequency of access, the use and performances of websites
- to adapt the presentation of the HH Build Models Section to the display preferences of your device (language, operating system etc.)
- to memorize preferences and parameters (authentication)
- to enable you to access reserved or personal spaces on 'CNR-IBF Hippocampus Facility Hub Project' websites
- to improve our communication and services.

We do not use cookies for commercial or profiling purposes.

Most web browsers automatically accept cookies but provide controls that allow you to block or delete them. Please refer to your browserâ€™s privacy or help documentation to find instructions for blocking or deleting cookies. For examples: Internet Explorer, Edge, Safari, Chrome, Firefox. If you choose to refuse cookies, you may not have access to certain functionality on the 'CNR-IBF Hippocampus Facility Hub Project' websites, which 'CNR-IBF Hippocampus Facility Hub Project' cannot be held responsible for.
